gurmukhi: ਬਹੁਰ ਜੋਤ ਸੋ ਜੋਤ ਮਿਲਾਨੀ ॥ ਸਭ ਜਗ ਅੈਸ ਕ੍ਰਿਅਾ ਪਹਿਚਾਨੀ ॥ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਰਾਜ ਰਾਜੁ ਜਗ ਕੀਨਾ ॥ ਅਤ੍ਰ ਪਤ੍ਰ ਸਿਰ ਢਾਰ ਨਵੀਨਾ ॥੧੩੫॥
transliteration: Bahur Jot So Jot Milaanee|| Sabh Jag Ais Kridaa Paihchaanee|| Sriraghrraaj Raaj(u) Jag Keedaa|| Atra Patra Sir Dhaar Naveenaa||135||
translation: The light of everyone merged in supreme light; and this activity continued in the world; the king Rahghu ruled over the world and wore new arms, weapons and canopies.135.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਭਾਂਤ ਕਰਿ ਜੱਗਿ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰਾ ॥ ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸ ਮਹਿ ਧਰਮ ਬਿਥਾਰਾ ॥ ਪਾਪੀ ਕੋੲੀ ਨਿਕਟਿ ਨ ਰਾਖਾ ॥ ਝੂਠ ਬੈਨ ਕਹੂ ਭੂਲ ਨ ਭਾਖਾ ॥੧੩੬॥
transliteration: Bahu Bhaant Kar(i) Jagg(i) Prakaaraa|| Des Des Maih Dharma Bithaaraa|| Paapikoinikattee Na Raakhaa|| Jhooth Bain Kahoo Bhool Na Bhaakhaa||136||
translation: He performed several types of Yajnas and spread the religion in all the countires; he did not allow any sinner to stay with him and never uttered falsehood, even through oversight.136.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਸਾ ਤਾਸ ਨਿਸਨਾਥ ਪਛਾਨਾ ॥ ਦਿਨਕਰ ਤਾਹਿ ਦਿਵਸ ਅਨਮਾਨਾ ॥ ਬੇਦਨ ਤਾਹਿ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਕਰਿ ਲੇਖਾ ॥ ਦੇਵਨ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਰੂਪ ਅਵਰੇਖਾ ॥੧੩੭॥
transliteration: Nisaa Taas Nisnaath Pachhaadaa|| Dinkar Taah(i) Divas Anmaanaa|| Bedan Raah(i) Brahm Kar(i) Likhaa|| Devan Indra Roop Avrekhaa||137||
translation: The nigh considered him as moon and the day as sun; the Vedas considered him as “Brahm” and the gods visualized him as Indra.137.

gurmukhi: ਬਿੱਪਨ ਸਭਨ ਬ੍ਹਸਪਤ ਦੇਖਯੋ ॥ ਦੈਤਨ ਗੁਰੂ ਸ਼ੁਕ੍ਰ ਕਰਿ ਪੇਖਯੋ ॥ ਰੋਗਨ ਤਾਹਿ ਅੳੁਖਧੀ ਮਾਨਾ ॥ ਜੋਗਨ ਪਰਮ ਤੱਤੁ ਪਹਿਚਾਨਾ ॥੧੩੮॥
transliteration: Bippan Sabhan Brahaspat Dekhyo|| Daitan Guroo Shoukra Kar(i) Pekhyo|| Rogad Taah(i) Aoukhadhimaanaa|| Jogad Param Tatt(u) Paihchaanaa||138||
translation: All the Brahmins saw in him the god Brihaspati and the demons as Shukracharya; the ailments looked at him as medicine and the Yogis visulised in him the supreme essence.138.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਲਨ ਬਾਲ ਰੂਪ ਅਵਰੇਖਯੋ ॥ ਜੋਗਨ ਮਹਾਂ ਜੋਗ ਕਰਿ ਦੇਖਯੋ ॥ ਦਾਤਨ ਮਹਾਂ ਦਾਨ ਕਰਿ ਮਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਭੋਗਨ ਭੋਗ ਰੂਪ ਪਹਚਾਨਯੋ ॥੧੩੯॥
transliteration: Baalan Baal Roop Avrekhyo|| Jogad Mahaan Jog Kar(i) Dekhyo|| Daatan Mahaan Daan Dar(i) Maanyo|| Bhogad Bhog Roop Pahchaanyo||139||
translation: The children saw him as a child and the Yogis as the supreme Yogi; the donors saw in him the supreme Donor and the pleasure seeking persons considered him as a Supreme Yogi.139.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸਨ ਦੱਤ ਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਜੋਗਨ ਗੁਰ ਗੋਰਖ ਕਰਿ ਮਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਰਾਮਾਨੰਦ ਬੈਰਾਗਨ ਜਾਨਾ ॥ ਮਹਾ ਦੀਨ ਤੁਰਕਨ ਪਹਚਾਨਾ ॥੧੪੦॥
transliteration: Sanniaasan Datt Roop Kar(i) Jaanyo|| Jogad Gur Gorakh Kar(i) Maanyo|| Raamaanand Bairaagad Jaanaa|| Mahaa Deen Turkan Pahchaanaa||140||
translation: The Sannyasis considered him as Dattatreya and the Yogis as Guru Gorakhnath; the Bairagis considered him as Ramanand and the Muslims as Muhammad.140. (This is a period-error).

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵਨ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਲੇਖਾ ॥ ਦੈਤਨ ਸੁੰਭ ਰਾਜ ਕਰਿ ਪੇਖਾ ॥ ਜੱਛਨ ਜੱਛ ਰਾਜ ਕਰਿ ਮਾਨਾ ॥ ਕਿੰਨ੍ਰਨ ਕਿੰਨ੍ਰ ਦੇਵ ਪਹਚਾਨਾ ॥੧੪੧॥
transliteration: Devan Indra Roop Kar(i) Lekhaa|| Daitan Sounbh Raaj Kar(i) Pekhaa|| Jahchhan Jachchh Raaj Kar(i) Maanaa|| Kinnran Kinnra Dev Pahchaanaa||141||
translation: The gods considered him as Indra and the demons as Shmbh; the Yakshas and Kinnar thought of him as their king.141.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮਨ ਕਾਮ ਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਦੇਖਯੋ ॥ ਰੋਗਨ ਰੂਪ ਧਨੰਤਰ ਪੇਖਯੋ ॥ ਰਾਜਨ ਲਖਯੋ ਰਾਜ ਅਧਿਕਾਰੀ ॥ ਜੋਗਨ ਲਖਯੋ ਜੋਗੀਸ਼ਰ ਭਾਰੀ ॥੧੪੨॥
transliteration: Kaamanndkaan Roop Kar(i) Dekhyo|| Rogad Dhanantar Pekhyo|| Raajan Lakhyo Raaj Adhikdaree|| Jogad Lakhyo Jodeeshar Bharee||142||
translation: The lustful women considered him as the god of love and the diseases thought of him as the incarnation of Dhanvantri; the kings considered him as the Sovereign and the Yogis thought of him s the Supreme Yogi.142.

gurmukhi: ਛਤ੍ਰਨ ਬਡੋ ਛਤ੍ਰਪਤਿ ਜਾਨਾ ॥ ਅਤ੍ਰਨ ਮਹਾ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਰ ਮਾਨਾ ॥ ਰਜਨੀ ਤਾਸ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਕਰਿ ਲੇਖਾ ॥ ਦਿਨੀਅਰ ਕਰਿ ਤਿਹ ਦਿਨ ਅਵਸੇਖਾ ॥੧੪੩॥
transliteration: Chhatran Bado Chhatrapati(i) Jaanaa|| Atran Mahaa Shastra Dhar Maanaa|| Rajnitaas Channdra Kar(i) Lekhaa|| Dineeaar Kar(i) Tih Din Avsekhaa||143||
translation: The Kshatriyas considered him the great canopied king and the wielders of arms and weapons thought of him as the great and powerful warrior; the night considered him as moon and the day as sun.143.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਤਨ ਸਾਂਤ ਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਪਾਵਕ ਤੇਜ ਰੂਪ ਅਨੁਮਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਧਰਤੀ ਤਾਸ ਧਰਾਧਰ ਜਾਨਾ ॥ ਹਰਣੀੲੇਣ ਰਾਜ ਪਹਚਾਨਾ ॥੧੪੪॥
transliteration: Santan Saant Roop Kar(i) Jaanyo|| Paavak Tej Roop Anoumaanyo|| Dhartitaas Roop Kar(i) Jaanyo Jaanaa|| Harneeen Raaj Pahchaanaa||144||
translation: The saints thought of him as manifestation of peace and the fire thought of him as effulgence; the earth considered him as a mountain and the does as the king of deer.144.

gurmukhi: ਛੱਤ੍ਰਨ ਤਾਸ ਛਤ੍ਰਪਤਿ ਸੂਝਾ ॥ ਜੋਗਨ ਮਹਾ ਜੋਗ ਕਰਿ ਬੂਝਾ ॥ ਹਿਮਧਰ ਤਾਹਿ ਹਿਮਾਲਯ ਜਾਨਾ ॥ ਦਿਨਕਰ ਅੰਧਕਾਰ ਅਨਮਾਨਾ ॥੧੪੫॥
transliteration: Chhattran Taas Chhatrapat(i) Soojhaa|| Jogad Mahaa Jog Kar(i) Boodheaa|| Himdhar Taah(i) Himaalaya Jaanaa|| Dinkar Andhkaar Anmaanaa||145||
translation: He appeared to the kshatris as Soverign and to the Yogis as Supreme Yogi; the mountains considered him as Himalaya and the darkness thought of him as the effulgence of the sun.145.

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਸਰੂਪ ਜਲ ਤਾਸ ਪਛਾਨਾ ॥ ਮੇਘਨ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਦੇਵ ਕਰ ਮਾਨਾ ॥ ਬੇਦਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਦੇਖਾ ॥ ਬਿੱਪਨ ਬਯਾਸ ਜਾਨਿ ਅਵਰੇਖਾ ॥੧੪੬॥
transliteration: Jal Saroop Jal Taas Pachhaadaa|| Meghan Indra Dev Kar Maanaa|| Bedan Brahm Roop Kar(i) Dekhaa|| Bippan Byaas Jaan(i) Avrekhaa||146||
translation: The water thought of him as the sea and the cloud considered him as Indra; the Vedas considered him as Brahman and the Brahmins imagined him as the sage Vyas.146.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਿਮੀ ਤਾਹਿ ਬਿਸ਼ਨ ਕਰਿ ਮਾਨਯੌ ॥ ਬਾਸਵ ਦੇਵ ਬਾਸਵੀ ਜਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਸੰਤਨ ਸਾਂਤ ਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਦੇਖਾ ॥ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰਨ ਕਲਹ ਸਰੂਪ ਬਿਸੇਖਾ ॥੧੪੭॥
transliteration: Lakhimitaah(i) Bishan Kar(i) Maanyau|| Baasav Dev Baasavi Jaanyo|| Santan Saant Roop Kar(i) Dekhaa|| Shattran Kalah Saroop Bisekhaa||147||
translation: Lakshmi considered him as Vishnu and Indrani as Indra; the saints saw him s peace-personified and the enemies as the clash-personified.147.
